answers.answer: Good news Jim---I found the 40 lbs. You can come and get it any time you like...roflSeriously though, congrats hun, that is a huge feat!!!
Attaboy!!!!  Keep up the good work!!!!
Impressive!! I wish I was a size 32 jeans!!

I don't think I've worn size 32 since my early 30's..30 years ago.Now if I could just keep it that way...the big secret?  1 word:  Dentures.  Food just isn't as good as it used to be and I find myself eating a lot less, and some excersize.  Also helps my diabetes as I am a borderline diabetic.  Can't wait to see what my next bloodwork shows.  And I know my pacemaker is working much less.  Had to have it put in due to a blockage of a nerve from my brain to my heart and my heart would forget to beat.  Passed out at work one day and off to the hospital they took me.  And my cholesterol and triglycerides are where they're supposed to be.It still ***** getting old...during the Thanksgiving week my brother and I were sitting around having a guiness or 2...we used to talk baseball and the Grateful Dead...we found ourselves talking about what we use to hold our dentures in..I said "do you hear what we're talking about?" and we laughed til guiness was coming out our noses ;-)Good night all.Jim
By summer we will have you in thong underpants and a speedo for the beach!!!  just sayin~~

question: 2 years ago I weighed 210 lbs, couldn't walk up the hill on our street without huffing and puffing, or walk from my car through the parking lot to to the office without huffing and puffing and having to stop for a few minutes (I later found that was because my brain wasn't talking to my heart on when to beat, thus a pacemaker)...and was wearing size 38 jeansAt any rate, today I'm at 170, wearing size 32 that are just a little snug but I'm in 'em and feeling so much better.slim Jim
title: Tootin' My Horn
